alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 14 at 11:03AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Grant, Clayton, Allamakee and Crawford Counties. Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Grant and Clayton Counties. .Warm temperatures this week have melted much of the regional snowpack. This snowmelt is routing into the Mississippi River. Rain this weekend is expected to further increase river flows. This additional rainfall and upstream inflow has increased the expected crests at McGregor between 18.5 to 20.5 feet around April 22-24 and at Guttenberg between 16.5 to 18.5 feet around April 22-24. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is expected. * WHERE...Mississippi River at McGregor. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Pumping operations begin at the Prairie du Chien waste water treatment facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage is expected to be reached early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM CDT.
